description: This schema documents and guides creation of a device descriptor, that both describes the interfaces available, and provides semantic mappings to those interfaces.
title: OSVR Device Descriptor

_88semanticAliasGrouping.description: A 'directory' on the semantic tree. May also contain an alias at its own level, described by '$target'
_88semanticAliasGrouping.title: Grouping for semantic aliases

$eref.description: A 'directory' on the semantic tree. May also contain an alias at its own level, described by '$target'
$eref.title: Grouping for semantic aliases

___automaticAliases.description: If no automatic (of greater priority) or user-specified (defaulting to high priority) alias exists at the given path, it will automatically be created. A priority may optionally be specified.
___automaticAliases.title: Automatically-suggested (absolute) aliases

___lastModified.description: Should use RFC 3339, section 5.6 format, aka javascript (new Date()).toJSON()
___lastModified.title: Static descriptor Last-Modified timestamp

___button.description: Describes properties of the button interface provided by this device.
___button.title: Button interface description

___analog.description: Describes properties of the analog interface provided by this device.
___analog.title: Analog interface description

___traits.description: Entries in this array are mapped directly to analog sensors/channels - entry 0 describes sensor 0, etc. Thus, if you want to describe sensor n, you must describe sensor n-1 (at least trivially with an empty object) down to 0.
___traits.title: Per-sensor traits

items.description: Describes relevant properties of the analog data reported on this sensor/channel. In the case of a joystick, the 'rest' will likely be halfway between 'min' and 'max', while an analog button will likely have 'min' equal to 'rest'. These parameters may be used for scaling the data as requested by a client application or analysis module.
items.title: Analog Sensor Traits

___tracker.description: Describes properties of the tracker interface provided by this device.
___tracker.title: Tracker interface description

___count.description: number of tracker sensors, if bounded and known
___count.title: Number of sensors

___bounded.description: true if the IDs of sensors reporting are bounded (usually known ahead of time) or false if they are unbounded (new ID for each item tracked, for instance)
___bounded.title: Sensor count bounded?

___traits.description: Array matching the order of sensors. Any values explicitly specified for a sensor here override the 'global' traits specified for the overall tracker interface. Entries in this array are mapped directly to sensors - entry 0 describes sensor 0, etc. Thus, if you want to describe sensor n, you must describe sensor n-1 (at least trivially with an empty object) down to 0.
___traits.title: Per-sensor traits

___author.title: Descriptor author name and email address
